definition: Guan Zhong (-645 BC), famous politician of Qi 齊國|齐国 of Spring and Autumn period/known as Guangzi 管子
a restricted view through a bamboo tube
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
second month of a season/middle/intermediate/second amongst brothers
surname Zhong

sentences.english: Later when the state of qi guanzhong ruler, and cao foam did lu general.
sentences.chinese: 後來管仲當了齊國的宰相，而曹沫做了魯國的將軍。

sentences.english: At that time , people didn't praise Guan Zhong's ability and talent but praised Bao Shuya's understanding of people.
sentences.chinese: 當時人們不稱讚管仲的賢能，而卻稱讚鮑叔牙的知人。

sentences.english: Hero of the story is the Duke Guan.
sentences.chinese: 故事的主人公是齊桓公管仲。

sentences.english: Duke Huan appointed Guan Zhong the chief minister, and yet the state of Qi was not peaceful and orderly.
sentences.chinese: 桓公任命管仲作上卿，可是齊國還不太平。

sentences.english: The policy thought of Guanzi was plentiful but full of influence.
sentences.chinese: 管仲的政策思想豐富而富有影響力。

sentences.english: Fuyang is the spring and autumn period, the poets hometown of guanzhong statesman of the native place.
sentences.chinese: 阜陽是春秋時期政治家管仲故里，詩人嵇康的桑梓。

sentences.english: Guan Zhong was the master of ancient Chinese city planning and construction.
sentences.chinese: 管仲堪稱中國古代城市規劃建設的一代宗師。

sentences.english: The second stage was from Guan Zhong's reformation to the Tian State substituting the Qi State.
sentences.chinese: 第二階段自管仲改革始，至田氏代齊止。

sentences.english: Guan Zhong is an important but controversial figure in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 管仲是中國歷史上一位有爭議的重要人物。

sentences.english: This is an one-sided view. The negative scholars insist that Confucius' does not evaluate Guan Zhong by the standard of benevolence.
sentences.chinese: 否定派認爲孔子未曾以仁論管仲，這是完全錯誤的。

sentences.english: And Confucius's evaluation of Guan Zhong has also been a disputed subject.
sentences.chinese: 孔子對管仲的評論，也成爲歷來一個有爭議的話題。

definition: Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

Shang Yang (c. 390-338 BC), legalist philosopher and statesman of the state of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], whose reforms paved the way for the eventual unification of the Chinese empire by the Qin dynasty 秦朝|秦朝[Qin2 chao2]
Yanzi (-c 500 BC), famous statesman from Qi of the Warring States, also known as 晏子, hero of book 晏子春秋
Fan Li (536-488 BC), politician of Yue state, businessman and economist
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Lord Menchang of Qi, Chancellor of Qi and of Wei during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Yanzi (-c 500 BC), famous statesman from Qi of the Warring States, also known as 晏婴, hero of book 晏子春秋
Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
Li Kui (455-395 BC), legalist philosopher and statesman of Wei state 魏國|魏国[Wei4 guo2]
King Xuan of Qi (reigned 342-324 BC)
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
Zi Chan (?-522 BC), statesman and philosopher during the Spring and Autumn period
Zhang Yi (-309 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)

Wu Qi (440-381 BC), military leader and politician of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC), author of Wuzi 吳子|吴子[Wu2 zi3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
Wuqi county in Yan'an 延安[Yan2 an1], Shaanxi
